title: 2007–08 West Midlands (Regional) League
text:
The 2007–08 West Midlands (Regional) League season was the 108th in the history of the <a href="West%20Midlands%20%28Regional%29%20League">West Midlands (Regional) League</a>, an English <a href="association%20football">association football</a> competition for semi-professional and amateur teams based in the <a href="West%20Midlands%20%28county%29">West Midlands county</a>, <a href="Shropshire">Shropshire</a>, <a href="Herefordshire">Herefordshire</a>, <a href="Worcestershire">Worcestershire</a> and southern <a href="Staffordshire">Staffordshire</a>. It has three divisions, the highest of which is the Premier Division, which sits at step 6 of the <a href="National%20League%20System">National League System</a>, or the tenth level of the overall <a href="English%20football%20league%20system">English football league system</a>.
Premier Division.
The Premier Division featured 19 clubs which competed in the division last season, along with two new clubs, promoted from Division One:
Also, Brierley & Hagley merged with Withymoor Colts to form <a href="Brierley%20Hill%20%26amp%3B%20Withymoor%20F.C.">Brierley Hill & Withymoor</a>.
